messages.subject: Re: Celebrating Autumn Equinox
messages.msgSnippet: This wasn t for Equinox... but when DS1 was quite young, we had friends who were very Waldorf-y , for lack of a better word. They hosted a Martinmas festival
messages.messageBody:
This wasn't for Equinox... but when DS1 was quite young, we had
friends who were very "Waldorf-y", for lack of a better word. They
hosted a Martinmas festival - part of that was the kids would carry a
lighted turnip lantern (easily made by carving a turnip!) through the
woods. It was very magical, and beautiful. Probably lots of things
about that are out there if you google "Waldorf festivals".

peace,
Caren

messages.subject: Re: Celebrating Autumn Equinox
messages.msgSnippet: I just posted these links to my local homeschooling group. maybe you ll find something there that will interest you and your family. Enjoy!
messages.messageBody:
